Leaching using chloridic acid facility
description:
The lithium-ion batteries are first made safe for mechanical treatment, with plastics, aluminium and copper separated and directed to their own recycling processes. And what is left of the battery after these processes are the chemical and mineral components, the ‘black mass’. The black mass typically consists of a mixture of lithium, manganese, cobalt and nickel in different ratios. Of these, nickel – and especially cobalt – are the most valuable and most difficult to recover.

The hydrometallurgical recycling process involves a chemical precipitation methodology that allows scarce minerals to be recovered and delivered to battery manufacturers for reuse in the production of new batteries.
features: 90% less CO2 emissions than traditional method_80% metal extraction efficiency_Developed by the Finnish growth company Crisolteq
realisedProject:
Harjavalta Industrial Park


Country: Finland

Year of construction: 2013

Substrates: Li-ion batteries 20 tonnes per day

Power capacity: 7.5MW

Tank volumes: 3 x 8200 m2 + 1 x 4000 m2

Technology: Sulfuric acid hydrolysis

carouselHTML: AOE anaerobic digestion facility
specifications: Anaerobic digestor with solid liquid seperation_10 to 20MW
description:
Anaerobic digestion consists of multiple natural biological processes characterized by microorganisms breaking down (or eating) biodegradable aka “organic” material—plant or animal matter—without the presence of oxygen.

This combustible anaerobic end product possesses a wide range of uses, including creating energy. Biogas generates heat and/or electricity when ignited, and can further be transformed into vehicular fuels and renewable natural gas. Other material left over following anaerobic digestion is known as “digestate”—typically a wet combination that can be separated into liquids and nutrient-rich solids.
features: Cuts harmful methane emissions that fuel climate change_Prevent and reduce wasted animal manure and other organic materials from ending up in landfills
realisedProject:
Yaphank Facility


Country: USA

Year of construction: 2016

Substrates: 180,000 tonnes food waste per year

Power capacity: 95MW

Tank volumes: 4 x 19500 m2

Technology: Anaerobic digestor facility
